intro: Wislizenia scabrida, commonly known as roughleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas, such as prairies and roadsides, and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture, while its purple to pink flowers bloom in late summer. Wislizenia scabrida is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
